title: Ticket #2643: Win32 Condor tries to use user from the submit host on remote host
description:
Discovered this when trying to use condor-c between two Windows submit machines, but the problem problem crops up in other areas. The basic problem is that condor tries to switch to a user@machine account on the remote submit machine using the originating submit machine's machine name.

In my test the originating submit machine is called CRANE and the user is johnkn. johnkn has local-machine accounts on both machines

The ScheddLog on the remote submit machine shows the following error: 

11/17/11 10:05:49 (pid:3668) perm::init: Lookup Account Name johnkn failed (err=1332), trying Everyone

This fails because the remote machine (VM-CRANE) is actually looking up account CRANE\johnkn which does not exist on VM-CRANE. What it should be doing to make Windows consitent with the way Linux works it be checking for the a johnkn account without a domain name.
